description:
Since this endpoint can be used to both update and to create a
project, the request body depends on the intent.

parameters.description: This can either be the username or the UUID of the account, surrounded by curly-braces, for example: `{account UUID}`. An account is either a team or user.
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: The project in question. This can either be the actual `key` assigned to the project or the `UUID` (surrounded by curly-braces (`{}`)).
parameters.name: project_key

200.description: The existing project is has been updated.

Location.description:
The location of the project. This header is only provided
when the project key is updated.

201.description: A new project has been created.

Location.description: The location of the newly created project

403.description: The requesting user isn't authorized to update or create the project.

404.description: A team doesn't exist at the location. Note that the project's absence from this location doesn't raise a 404, since a PUT at a non-existent location can be used to create a new project.
